children.text: There are oversized holes in the structural plywood bracing sheets, and the opening of the hole has not been framed out and fixed to support it.

The plywood sheet bracing installation is a vital structural member in the dwelling. It stops the house from moving when racking forces, such as wind, are applied to a dwelling. The relevant Australian Standard, AS 2269 Plywood - Structural, states that

an envelope of 100mm from the vertical and top edges and 200mm of the bottom edge of the bracing panel will have no significant effect on the bracing capacity. Multiple 100mm x 100mm holes are allowable within the envelope but their centres must be no closer than 600mm. One hole of up to 400mm x 400mm located between the studs and within the envelope defined above, with nogging framing the hole and fixing of the plywood to the framing as per the requirements for the top and bottom plate is acceptable’ .
Additional framing should be installed, with the edges of the holes secured with additional fixings.
